Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was bona fide
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative – inconsistencies in testimony affected credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, documentary evidence related to marriage
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Subsection 4(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine; primarily for immigration purposes
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in testimony regarding birth control, ceremonies, and personal knowledge
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Appeal before the Immigration Appeal Division
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Subsection 4(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Application_Error: Alleged misapplication of legal test for bona fide marriage
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Bona fide marriage with intent to reside permanently together
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Primarily for immigration purposes without intent to cohabit permanently
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Spouse not eligible under family class
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness and reasonableness of legal test application
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Subsection 4(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent statements on key marital facts
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Significant credibility concerns due to conflicting accounts
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant challenged credibility findings and legal test application
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review over administrative decisions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Marriage not bona fide, potential misrepresentation

Crimes.Crime_Name: Marriage Fraud under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was bona fide
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative – inconsistencies undermined genuineness of marriage
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, details of marriage ceremonies and personal relationship
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Subsection 4(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage entered into primarily for immigration benefit
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Discrepancies in knowledge of each other, birth control use, and ceremony timing
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Appeal before the Immigration Appeal Division
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Subsection 4(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Application_Error: Claimed incorrect application of legal test for genuine marriage
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Intent to establish genuine marital life together
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage not primarily for immigration purposes
Crimes.Application_Factor: Behavior and statements indicating lack of genuine relationship
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Was the legal test correctly applied?
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Subsection 4(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Marriage not genuine; suspected for immigration advantage
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictory testimony on intimate aspects of relationship
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process deemed fair and in accordance with law
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Serious credibility problems affecting reliability of claims
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Appellant contested both factual findings and legal interpretation
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Limits of court intervention in administrative appeals
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Marriage fraud, failure to meet bona fide requirement
